The common functions are within this namespace.


namespace  boost::xint::blockable
 

Contains the blockable integer type, and functions to operate on it.


Functions

Modular math functions

A common reason to use a large-integer library is to implement public-key encryption, and the algorithms for such encryption often use modular math.

integer boost::xint::blockable::mod (const integer &n, const integer &m)
integer boost::xint::blockable::mulmod (const integer &n, const integer &by, const integer &m)
integer boost::xint::blockable::sqrmod (const integer &n, const integer &m)
integer boost::xint::blockable::powmod (const integer &n, const integer &e, const integer &m, bool noMontgomery)

Detailed Description

Contains the definitions for the basic modular math functions for blockable integers.

The xint::invmod function, which logically would be here, is actually in gcd.cpp to share the gcd_core function.

Definition in file blockable_modular.cpp.
